Issues.Title: We need tests for calling COM interface methods from c++
Issues.Body:
We need tests for various interfaces implemented by managed classes (e.g. IOleControlSite etc)

The best way to test this would be to implement tests in c++ and PInvoke them passing the managed class as an interface as an a IntPtr to unmanaged code. Weâ€™d then call functions from c++ and test things like HRESULTS etc

I have a prototype but not sure how to integrate a test c++ dll  into the product infrastructure
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "We need tests for calling COM interface methods from c++" (#1817)

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "[master] Update dependencies from dotnet/core-setup" (#1806)

Issues.Title: Cleanup misc Ole32 interop
Issues.Body:
## Proposed changes

- Cleanup CoCreateInstance/CoGetClassObject: don't use `PreserveSig` but instead use `HRESULT`s
- Fix OleInitialize incorrect definition (should take IntPtr not int)
- Fix OleUnitialize incorrect definition (should return `void` not int)
- Cleanup definition of `IClassFactory2`
- Structify `LICINFO`

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](http://wpcp.azurewebsites.net/CodeFlowProtocolProxy2.php?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/1805)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Cleanup misc Ole32 interop" (#1805)
